user_message:
An agent A claimed that the following MHD_monotonic_sec_counter code violates the MISRA C 2023 rule 2.1.
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<target_code>
Here is the original code of MHD_monotonic_sec_counter.
```c
time_t
MHD_monotonic_sec_counter (void)
{
#ifdef HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
  struct timespec ts;

  if ( (_MHD_UNWANTED_CLOCK != mono_clock_id) &&
       (0 == clock_gettime (mono_clock_id,
                            &ts)) )
    return ts.tv_sec - mono_clock_start;
#endif /* HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME */
#ifdef HAVE_CLOCK_GET_TIME
  if (_MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV != mono_clock_service)
  {
    mach_timespec_t cur_time;

    if (KERN_SUCCESS == clock_get_time (mono_clock_service,
                                        &cur_time))
      return cur_time.tv_sec - mono_clock_start;
  }
#endif /* HAVE_CLOCK_GET_TIME */
#if defined(_WIN32)
#if _WIN32_WINNT >= 0x0600
  if (1)
    return (time_t) (((uint64_t) (GetTickCount64 () - tick_start)) / 1000);
#else  /* _WIN32_WINNT < 0x0600 */
  if (0 != perf_freq)
  {
    LARGE_INTEGER perf_counter;

    QueryPerformanceCounter (&perf_counter);   /* never fail on XP and later */
    return (time_t) (((uint64_t) perf_counter.QuadPart - perf_start)
                     / perf_freq);
  }
#endif /* _WIN32_WINNT < 0x0600 */
#endif /* _WIN32 */
#ifdef HAVE_GETHRTIME
  if (1)
    return (time_t) (((uint64_t) (gethrtime () - hrtime_start)) / 1000000000);
#endif /* HAVE_GETHRTIME */

  return time (NULL) - sys_clock_start;
}
```
</target_code>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- explanation: your evaluation of the scenario provided by the agent A.
- is_report_correct: whether the report is correct or not (true/false). True means there is a violation.
</response format>
<scenario>
The agent A provided the following violation scenario:
If HAVE_GETHRTIME is defined in the project build, the 'if (1) return ...' is an unconditional return: execution will always take that return when the block is compiled, making the subsequent code in the function (for example the final 'return time(NULL) - sys_clock_start;') unreachable in that build. This constitutes a violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 (unreachable code).
</scenario>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function MHD_monotonic_sec_counter:
#define HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME 1
...
static clockid_t mono_clock_id = _MHD_UNWANTED_CLOCK
...
#define _MHD_UNWANTED_CLOCK CLOCK_REALTIME
...
static time_t mono_clock_start
...
static time_t sys_clock_start
</additional code>

<instruction>
Judge whether the report is correct or not.
</instruction>
explanation: MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.1 forbids unreachable code (code that can never be executed). In the provided function, when the build defines HAVE_GETHRTIME the preprocessor will include the block containing 'if (1) return ...'. The condition 'if (1)' is a compile-time constant true, so execution of the function will always return at that point and control will never reach the subsequent statements (including the final 'return time(NULL) - sys_clock_start;'). That constitutes unreachable code in that build configuration, and therefore the agent A's report is correct for any project build that defines HAVE_GETHRTIME.
